title: Invermoriston Falls Walk Route

images.title: Invermoriston Falls by Peter Moore, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Invermoriston Falls

images.title: Telford's bridge at Invermoriston by Steven Brown, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Telford's bridge. This bridge used to form part of the main road between Drumnadrochit and Fort Augustus but was replaced in the 1930s with the new bridge used today

images.title: Richard Webb / Glen Moriston Arms
images.caption: Glen Moriston Arms in the village. Invermoriston's attractions include this hotel, a village shop, clog and craft shop as well as a coffee shop/restaurant.

images.title: John Allan / The Old School House - Invermoriston
images.caption: The Old School House - Invermoriston. Looking south to Sron na Muic. From the top of the hill above the village, Sròn Na Muic (Scottish Gaelic for "The Nose of the Pig"), one can admire the loveliest views of the Great Glen.

images.title: Summer House on River Moriston by John S Ross, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Summer House on River Moriston

images.title: Colin Smith / Falls of Invermoriston
images.caption: Falls of Invermoriston. The River Moriston falling over a rocky sill on its way to Loch Ness. Note the rounded potholes on its tumbling banks

description: This walk visits the picturesque Invermoriston Falls at Loch Ness in the Scottish Highlands. In the little village can enjoy a walk across the old Thomas Telford bridge which crosses the picturesque falls on the River Moriston. From the public car park it is a short stroll south to the early 19th century bridge. After admiring the rushing river you can then follow footpaths through the adjacent woodland for more great views. The epic Great Glen Way runs through the village. You could pick up this waymarked footpath to further explore the area. You could follow the trail south west along Loch Ness to visit Fort Augustus.
